name: Neon Slasher
description:
Welcome to Neon Slasher, a game where you need to surive an ever increasing amount of enemies by dashing through them!

CONTROLS:

  • Menu
    • A button to start game
    • B button to exit
  • Game
    • A button to dash through enemies. Dash cooldown is reset if you hit an enemy
    • B button to heal at the healing station (grey square in the level, makes a distinct continuous sound while on it). Healing requires 10 Gold which you get from killing enemies
    • Start to pause game
  • Pause Menu
    • Start to unpause
    • Back/Select to quit to main menu

ATTENTION:

GAME REQUIRES XINPUT CONTROLLER (SUCH AS XBOX 360 OR XBOX ONE)

HEADPHONES HIGHLY SUGGESTED

NOTES:

Neon Slasher is a very early prototype. The prototype was made for two different classes in university.

Neon Slasher at this point, is a test experiment game for an essay titled "Game Design for Visually Impaired People", and right now the main focus of the game is to study some game design patterns that can help visually impaired people to play video games.

It is suggested to play this game in two different ways:

  • Normally, with the screen on
  • Blindfolded or with the screen off

This is to allow the player to simulate the difficulties of a visually impaired person when playing video games.

After playing the game, I'd be grateful if you could fill out a very short survey about your experience, and maybe leave a comment about on what to improve, in regards to making the experience for visually impaired people better.

Fill the form about Neon Slasher here (If you played it both ways, fill the form two times!)
